ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:0.4_0: The sub-chapter on the dark of the night
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:0.5_0: The training rule on talking out in the open
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:1.2_0: On one occasion a nun who was a pupil of Bhaddā Kāpilānī went to Sāvatthī on some business.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:1.4_0: knowing that the Buddha had prohibited standing or talking alone with a man in a concealed place, and she instead stood and talked alone with that man in the open.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:1.5_0: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized Thullanandā,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:1.6_0: “How can a nun do such a thing?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:1.7_0: “Is it true, monks, that a nun did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:1.10_0: “... How can a nun do such a thing?
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:1.11_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:1.12_0: the Buddha said, “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:1.13.1_0: ‘If a nun stands or talks alone with a man out in the open, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:2.4_0: ... The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:2.6_0: not concealed by a wall, a door, a screen, a cloth screen, a tree, a pillar, a grain container, or anything else.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:2.8_0: a human male, not a male spirit, not a male ghost, not a male animal. He understands and is capable of standing together and talking.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:2.10_0: The Buddha then sat down together.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:2.12_0: just the man and the nun.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:2.14_0: if she stands within arm’s reach of a man, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:2.16_0: if she stands within arm’s reach of a man, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:2.17_0: If she stands or talks outside of arm’s reach, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:2.18_0: If he talks with a female spirit, with a female ghost, with a _paṇḍaka_, or with a female animal in the form of a monk, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:2.20_0: if he has a companion who understands;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:2.24_0: if she is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc13:2.25_0: The third rule, the third training rule on fire, is finished.
